answers.answer: You might be experiencing problems with low blood sugar which might or might not be related to diabetes. I wouldn't advise eating sugar (sweets) on a regular basis, especially with diabetes in your family. Some other carbohydrates or fruit can serve the same purpose. If it's been a year, it might be time to tell your doctor about these symptoms and re-check. Thyroid problems can create anxiety and all sorts of other symptoms so check that as well.

question: im often low in energy and i think when i eat sweets or banannas i have more energy.  im often anxious alot which deff have psychological roots but does blood sugar also affect this?   i had blood tests last done a year ago and everything is fine being tested for diabeties.  it runs in my mothers family and thyroid problems which i was clear for a year ago with the same symtoms as now at the time.   is there any type of tablet of sugar or glucose that releases slowly during the day to keep ebergy levels normal. i eat normally infact i have to eat alot every 2  1/2 - 3 hours.
title: Blood sugars question (not diabetic)
